execute(((address,bytes,uint32,uint32,ad.details: Can be called prior to or after `handle`, depending if fast liquidity is being used.

handle(uint32,uint32,bytes32,bytes).details: This function relies on nomad relayers and should not consume arbitrary amounts of gas

params._nonce: The unique identifier for the message from origin to destination

xcall(((address,bytes,uint32,uint32,addr.details: This contract must have approval to transfer the adopted assets. They are then swapped to the local nomad assets via the configured AMM and sent over the bridge router.

returns._0: The transfer id of the crosschain transfer

Executed(bytes32,address,((address,bytes.notice: Emitted when `execute` is called on the destination chain

ExecutorUpdated(address,address,address).notice: Emitted when the executor variable is updated

PromiseRouterUpdated(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when the promiseRouter variable is updated

Reconciled(bytes32,uint32,address[],addr.notice: Emitted when `reconciled` is called by the bridge on the destination domain

SponsorVaultUpdated(address,address,addr.notice: Emitted when the sponsorVault variable is updated

TransferRelayerFeesUpdated(bytes32,uint2.notice: Emitted when `bumpTransfer` is called by an user on the origin domain

XCalled(bytes32,((address,bytes,uint32,u.notice: Emitted when `xcall` is called on the origin domain

bumpTransfer(bytes32).notice: Anyone can call this function on the origin domain to increase the relayer fee for a transfer.

execute(((address,bytes,uint32,uint32,ad.notice: Called on the destination domain to disburse correct assets to end recipient and execute any included calldata

xcall(((address,bytes,uint32,uint32,addr.notice: This function is called by a user who is looking to bridge funds
